msContents.summary: Side 1: Receipt issued to a cultivator by the nomarch acknowledging payment of the year's rent for a plot of land which had belonged to the Queen of Ptolemy Neos Dionysus, and was now apparently part of the common property of the city of Arsinoe. (Grenfell, Hunt, and Hogarth) Side 2: receipt for rent.

msItemStruct.note: Text is with the fibers on both sides. Text on Side 1 mentions the village of Theadelphia and alludes to the city of Arsinoe.
Side 1: 9 lines. Top, left, and bottom margins intact. Right margin is visible.
Side 2: 1 line, written along the fibers, perpendicular to the text on the other side.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 10.2 x 22.4cm. Two pieces of papyri joined together with tape down the center. Several tears and wormholes and one large hole in the center. All margins clearly visible.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1898-9) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Side 1: Apion, nomarch, through Heron, to Heracleos, cultivator, and his partners, greeting. I have received from you the rent of the plot cultivated by you near the village of Theadelphia belonging to the corporation of the city and formerly to the Queen of Ptolemey Neos Dionysus, on account of the produce of the twelfth year, in full. The twelfth year, Epeiph 22. (Grenfell, Hunt, and Hogarth)
Side 2: receipt of Heracleos and his partners

listBibl.bibl: P. Fay. 88 John R. Abercrombie, "The University Museum's Collection of Papyri and Related Materials," Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37.
